note: Feature proposal for gamete-based persona fusion alongside existing budding
what: Sexual reproduction model for personas

note: Starting needs discovery to inform feature prioritization and architecture
what: Interview user about vscode-rhizome extension requirements

note: Extracted core needs through guided conversation: context fragmentation, AI heavy solutions, TDD/property-based testing, pseudocode workflow, user-story-tagged functions, fuzz testing properties
what: Needs discovery interview: user stories and core functionality

note: Three trigger mechanisms explored: naming pattern (TODO_), docstring detection (// TODO above), keyboard shortcut (Tab/Ctrl+Alt+S). Need to choose which prevents false positives while staying intuitive.
what: Map activation patterns for pseudocode stub generation

note: Two modes: @rhizome stub (type-based inference), @rhizome stub infer (LLM-powered). Generates function with docstring, properties, NotImplementedError, TODO. Works TS/JS/Python. LLM config TBD.
what: Pseudocode stub generation via @rhizome stub command with properties inference

note: Type-based: fast, always available. LLM-infer: richer properties on demand. Both generate function with docstring+properties+NotImplementedError+TODO. Works TS/JS/Python.
what: Stub command: two modes (type-infer default, LLM-infer on-demand)

note: Proposed structure links to: stub commands (Pseudocode Without Friction), inference layers (Test-Driven Top-Down), language adapters (multi-language support), config layer (LLM backend). Open questions: parsing strategy, code insertion UX, config location.
what: Extension file structure: src/, test/, config organized by concern

note: Implements: extension startup, command registration framework. Serves: Stay Grounded in Code (extension always ready). Depends on: package.json activation events. Gap: which commands to register?
what: Entry point: activate/deactivate extension, register commands

note: Implements: activation event (onStartupFinished), command definitions, extension metadata. Serves: extension startup and discoverability. Depends on: extension.ts commands. Gap: which activation event? lazy vs always-on?
what: VSCode extension contract: metadata, activation, commands, contributions

note: Implements: TypeScript → JavaScript transpilation for VSCode runtime. Serves: all TS code compiles correctly. Depends on: extension.ts, future src/ code. Gap: which target version? ES2020+?
what: TypeScript compilation config: target, module, outDir

note: Implements: F5 debugging setup, debug host, breakpoints. Serves: local development and testing. Depends on: extension.ts, tsconfig.json. Gap: which debug approach?
what: VSCode debug configuration: run extension in debug mode

note: Layer to talk to LLM (Claude, local, configurable) with @rhizome persona context. MCP stub to forward commands. Allows: property inference, code review via personas, decision logging. Serves: Understand Before Commit, Test-Driven Top-Down.
what: LLM communication with rhizome-aware comments and MCP stub

note: Abstraction over LLM provider. Enables: API key config, model selection, fallback behavior. Depends on: config/extensionConfig. Serves: Understand Before Commit, property inference, LLM infer mode.
what: LLM client: abstract interface for talking to Claude/local/other

note: Builds context from: active persona, decision phase, current code context. Passes to LLM so responses are persona-aware. Serves: all user stories (decisions grounded in personas). Depends on: llmClient, .rhizome personas.
what: Rhizome context builder: attach persona/role/phase to LLM prompts

note: MCP (Model Context Protocol) server stub. Listens for @rhizome prompts in comments. Forwards to: external Claude session, rhizome CLI, decision logging. Serves: Understand Before Commit (async LLM help), Stay Grounded (keep decisions in-editor). Depends on: llmClient, rhizomeContext.
what: MCP stub: forward @rhizome commands to external tools/Claude

note: Design: RhizomeBackend interface with multiple implementations (CLIBackend, MCPBackend). Extension depends on interface, not concrete impl. Strategy: start with CLI (already installed), swap to MCP later for user distribution without refactoring extension.
what: Backend abstraction: swap CLI/MCP without changing extension code

note: Implements RhizomeBackend interface. Spawns rhizome process, parses output (JSON), handles errors. Fast path for bootstrap. Depends on: rhizome in PATH. User Story: bootstrap with existing tools.
what: CLIBackend: call rhizome CLI directly via child_process

note: Implements RhizomeBackend interface. Calls MCP server (localhost:port), handles JSON-RPC protocol. Future path for user distribution. Depends on: MCP server running. User Story: scale to users, no Python dependency.
what: MCPBackend: call rhizome via MCP microservice on localhost

note: Abstract interface. Methods: record(), personaList(), personaShow(), personaAdopt(), etc. Extension depends on this interface, not concrete impl. Enables swap between CLIBackend and MCPBackend.
what: RhizomeBackend interface: abstraction over CLI and MCP implementations

note: HTML comments in QUICKSTART.md and syllabus.md guide course creators through thinking (not just doing). Questions appear in VSCode, invisible to students. Forces clarity on: outcomes, assessments, accessibility, AI use. Branch: don-socratic-questions
what: Inline Socratic comments threaded through 1cc course template

note: Module 1-4: each assignment now has don-socratic comments questioning design choices, pedagogical reasoning, accessibility, psychological safety. Questions appear in VSCode markdown files, invisible to students. Commit: all assignments updated with TODOs and challenges. Branch: don-socratic-questions
what: Inline Socratic questions embedded in all 4 module assignments

note: Core feature: users select code, right-click 'Ask don-socratic', receive Socratic questioning. Command registered first (before stub). Discoverable via context menu. Don is always listening, ready to guide reflection. Updates: package.json keywords/description, extension.ts command structure, context menu integration.
what: don-socratic as fundamental feature of vscode-rhizome extension

note: Highest risk area. Unknown VSCode extension patterns. Need to: register command, create webview panel, wire message passing (extension ↔ webview), handle async responses from rhizome CLI backend.
what: Implement extension.ts: VSCode command registration, message passing, webview lifecycle

note: New capability: ask a persona something directly, get LLM response with persona voice. Minimum viable: single-turn Q&A with persona identity. Design questions: local context? which personas? new CLI command or extend existing? Error handling for LLM failures. This informs extension.ts message-passing design.
what: Design & implement rhizome CLI persona-LLM interaction

note: Bridge between vscode-rhizome and rhizome CLI. Needs method to call persona-LLM interaction, handle responses, propagate errors back to webview.
what: Implement cliBackend.ts: method to invoke rhizome persona-LLM command

note: Webview needs to send question to extension, handle loading states while extension calls CLI backend, receive and display persona response.
what: Webview message handling: async LLM responses from persona

note: Decision: all action types as nodes | explicit+semantic edges (weight explicit higher) | cluster-by-phase initial view | <2s performance target | force-directed visualization | phase navigator + search + recommendations
what: Knowledge graph browser: node types, edge inference, view strategy, performance target

note: Starting work on graphBuilder module to parse actions.ndjson into knowledge graph
